abstracts.cdata!:
The Fifth and Sixth Highway Projects in
            Madagascar was only partially successful in attaining its
            objectives. The relation between the Bank and the Borrower
            were strained during appraisal of the Fifth Project to the
            point of jeopardizing the operation itself. Relations
            improved thereafter but a distant and independent stance can
            be detected on the part of the Borrower with the minimum
            necessary flow of information taking place. The favorable
            evolution of the Borrower's views has been the result
            of interaction with missions, interaction with consultants
            and direct absorption of the experience generated. The
            overlap of the project seems to have allowed almost
            immediate application of lessons and experience in a way not
            always possible in stand alone operations.
